intro: Uragoga longistipulata, commonly known as the long-stipule uragoga, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its elongated stipules, which are leaf-like structures at the base of the petioles. Its flowers are typically showy, with five petals and a distinctive, hairy calyx. Uragoga longistipulata is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as rainforests and along riverbanks.
